Constructor Detail

Table

public Table()
To Create a table with a schema we first have to declare a row which must be a subclass of the com.tightdb.Row, in which we will declare the attributes of the table. Suppose we want to create a table to keep track of the employees of a company. we want to keep the firstname, lastname, age and a couple of phone numbers (type, number) for a particular employee. For this purpose we first have to declare a table PhoneNumber which will be used to store the phone number. class PhoneNumber extents Row { String type; String number; } In the next step we have to define the row of a indiviual row of the employee table. class Employee extends Row { String firstName; String lastName; Table phoneNumbers; } Now we can create the table to store the records of a employee as Table employees = new Table();

Parameters:
jsonRowStructure -

public void removeRow(int rowIndex)
Removes a row from the specific index. As of now the entry is simply removed from the table. No Cascading delete for other table is not taken care of.

min

public java.lang.Object min(java.lang.String columnName)
Returns the minimum value of a specific row. For the types Integer, Boolean (false is assumed to be less than true), String, Date the minimum value is returned. In case of Row (child of Row) the two row are compared and mininum is returned.

Parameters:
columnName - Name of the column.

at

public T at(int index)
Fetch an row at a particular index of the table. if the index is < 0 or index is greater than the number of elements in the table an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
